    • Method Detail

      • facebookGraphInterface

        public void facebookGraphInterface(Map<String,Object> params,
                          ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Make Facebook posts on behalf of the user.

        Target API Endpoint: /facebook/graph

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.event
          the type of Sirqul event {DOWNLOADED_APP, CHALLENGE, LEVEL_COMPLETED, LEVEL_CREATED}
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableType
          for posting about information related to an object. Possible types: {ALBUM, ALBUM_CONTEST, GAME_LEVEL, THEME_DESCRIPTOR}
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableId
          the object id
        • SirqulKeys.assetId
          used to include an asset on a Facebook post
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key to specify which application the post came from. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user, used to update their known location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FacebookApiBase.facebookGraphInterface

      • getFacebookToken

        public void getFacebookToken(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<TokenResponse> callback)
        Gets a user's Facebook token.

        Target API Endpoint: /facebook/getfbtoken

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          used to update the user's current location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a TokenResponse containing the Facebook token, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FacebookApiBase.getFacebookToken

      • loginWithFacebook

        public void loginWithFacebook(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Login via Facebook. Creates a new account if logging in for the first time.

        Target API Endpoint: /facebook/login

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.token
          the token from Facebook
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.ageRestriction
          checks user's birthday to see if they meet an age requirement. If the user is under age, an error message is returned.
        • SirqulKeys.returnProfile
          determines whether to return a ProfileResponse on success, or a PaymentTypesResponse. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.responseFilters
          if returnProfile is set to true, this determines how much of the profile should be returned, see Enums.ProfileFilters
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          used to update the user's current location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FacebookApiBase.loginWithFacebook
